CD.descrição: A Vida Que Eu Escolhi é o décimo segundo álbum de estúdio a solo do cantor português Tony Carreira. Foi lançado em 2006 pela editora Espacial.
Hide Your Heart (released under the title Notes from America in the United States, Canada and Brazil), is the seventh studio album by Welsh singer Bonnie Tyler.
Greatest Hits is a compilation album by Dolly Parton, released in October 1982. It focused mostly on Parton's late 1970s pop hits.
Still Got the Blues is the eighth solo studio album by Northern Irish guitarist Gary Moore, released in 1990.
Eros is the first greatest hits album by Italian pop/rock singer Eros Ramazzotti, released in 1997 on the BMG label.
One Night Only is a live album and DVD/Blu-ray by the Bee Gees.
Doctor Hook, later released as Sylvia's Mother, is the debut studio album by American country rock band Dr. Hook & the Medicine Show, released in 1972.
"Maggie May" is a song co-written by singer Rod Stewart and Martin Quittenton, and performed by Rod Stewart on his album Every Picture Tells a Story, released in 1971.
Romanza is the first compilation album by Italian singer Andrea Bocelli, released internationally in 1996.

CD.título: When a man loves a woman
CD.descrição: "When a Man Loves a Woman" is a song written by Calvin Lewis and Andrew Wright and first recorded by Percy Sledge in 1966 at Norala Sound Studio in Sheffield, Alabama.

In 1996 The Savage Rose received a Danish Music Award for the album Black Angel, which was recorded in the US. The band's debut album, The Savage Rose, was chosen as part of the Danish Culture Canon in 2006.
The Grammy Nominees is a series of various artists compilation albums celebrating the best of the music industry.
The discography of Kenny Rogers, an American country music singer, consists of 39 studio albums and 80 singles, 21 of which have reached Number One on the country chart.
Big Willie Style is the debut solo album by American hip hop recording artist Will Smith.
Tupelo Honey is the fifth studio album by Northern Irish singer-songwriter Van Morrison.
Bridge of Spies is the debut album by British pop group T'Pau, released in September 1987.
Private Dancer is the fifth solo studio album by Tina Turner.
In the Middle of the Night (Danish: Midt om natten) is a 1984 Danish musical drama film directed by Erik Balling, which was the final film project Balling ever directed before his death.
The Dock of the Bay is the first of a number of posthumously released Otis Redding albums, and his seventh studio album.
Picture Book is the debut album by British pop and soul group Simply Red, released in October 1985.
Red is the second album from British pop duo The Communards.
Unchain My Heart is the eleventh studio album by Joe Cocker, released in 1987.
